body:
# Welcome to Notestack

This is my digital "graduation" project from the [neuefische coding bootcamp](https://neuefische.de).

It is still work in progress. I am still improving the app, fixing bugs and adding new features to improve and showcase my coding skills.

You can see my code at https://github.com/xbow/notestack.

You can edit and add notes. As of now, they will only be saved locally in your browser (local storage).

## Features:

### Take notes in Markup
	
* using [CodeMirror](https://codemirror.net/) with [react-codemirror2](https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-codemirror2) for editing notes
* using [react-markdown](https://github.com/rexxars/react-markdown) for viewing notes

### Topics and Keywords

* When creating a note, you can first enter a "topic", and then, as many "keywords" as you like.
* Existing topics or keywords are suggested as you type.
* (WIP) A topics and keywords browser that quickly lets you find a note on a specific issue (at this time, it only shows a simple list of topics and keywords).

### Other features

* Notes can be deleted. Click the trash icon in the top navigation to see a list of deleted notes with the option to restore a specific note.

## Planned Features:

### User Stories:

* UI improvements:
	
    * better guide user through creating a new note
    * notify user when note has been saved
    
* Tag Browser to find notes by Topics and Keywords
* Filter and sort functions for list
* Timestamp notes (creation date and date of last change)

### Code improvements:

* Handle all states with redux (currently, some components still have their own state)
* Refactor some components to make the code cleaner and more systematic
* Add more automated testing

# This is a headline

## And a level 2 headline

Some markdown examples:

You can make text **bold** or *italic*.

## This is a headline

Here comes a list:

* List item 1

	* second level item A
    
    * second level item B

* List item 2

* [This is a link](https://github.com/xbow/notestack)

## formatting code:

Use single backticks to format text as code, e.g. `console.log('Hello world')`, or triple-backticks for a whole block of code:


```
//this is a block of code:
## Headline

* List item 1
* List item 2

* [This is a link](https://github.com/xbow/notestack)
```

This is a placeholder note with a few sample tags.
